titles.title: Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2004
Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2004
A bill to ensure that Members of Congress do not receive better prescription drug benefits than medicare beneficiaries.

action.text: Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

calendar.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 644.

bill.summary: Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2004 - Prohibits the actuarial value of the prescription drug benefits of any Member of Congress enrolled in a Federal health benefits plan from exceeding the actuarial value of basic prescription drug coverage as defined in the Voluntary Prescription Drug Benefit Program of the Social Security Act.
